subject: Calculus
title: Finding Equation of Tangent Lines
openingStatement: A tangent line is a line that 'touches' a point of another function (usually a curve). In other words, a tangent line is a linear function that shares one and only one point with another non-linear function. In order to help us find the equation (linear function) of a tangent line, we will make use of a foundational concept in Calculus known as Limits.
exerciseStatement: Find the equation of the tangent line at the specified point for the following curves.
